result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas Michael Henn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Received and filed with court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Douglas Michael Henn in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME; credit for 8 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending review hearing.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and a Mental Health Evaluation.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No violent contact with Stephanie H. and her children.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court waived costs, fees and assessments, but shall pay 3 DNA surcharges, 1 Domestic Abuse assessment and all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief. 
AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court imposed the following sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 5 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 3 YEARS with credit for 0 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 2 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant.  The Court STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION & EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH; Huber privileges to apply for AODA, BIP, mental health treatment and child care not to exceed 20 hours per week; no good time credit.  Court does not oppose Electronic Monitoring Surveillance.  The Court further ordered defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending review hearing.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
-  All other conditions entered on Count 2 shall apply to Count 4.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief. 
AS TO COUNT 5:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME; credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending review hearing.
- All other conditions entered on Count 2 shall apply to Count 5.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief. 
Filed,
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Court ordered case adjourned for probation review hearing in Branch 23.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 23 on 8-25-2014 at 8:30 am. Defendant Douglas Michael Henn in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Douglas Michael Henn in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
